content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you can define this function in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(x -> first(x) == uppercase(first(x)), words)
end
```

In this code, `filter` is a high-order function that applies the provided function (in this case an anonymous function checking if the first character of each string is capitalized) to all elements in the collection (in this case the list of words). The result is a new list containing only those elements for which the provided function returned true.

You can call this function with a list of words as follows:

```julia
words = ["dog", "Cat", "Dog", "elephant", "Elephant"]
println(keep_only_names(words))  # Outputs: ["Cat", "Dog", "Elephant"]
```
